    • Method Detail

      • checkSizeRange

        public static <T> void checkSizeRange(Collection<T> ref,
                      int minSize,
                      int maxSize,
                      String argName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and its size within specified range. Size is defined as the number of elements.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        minSize - minimum number of elements (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        maxSize - maximum number of elements (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref or argName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if minSize < 0, or if maxSize < 0, or if minSize > maxSize, or if number of elements in ref is outside allowed range, or if argName is empty or whitespace
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkMinSize(Collection, int, String), checkMaxSize(Collection, int, String), checkExactSize(Collection, int, String)

      • checkNotEmpty

        public static <T> void checkNotEmpty(Collection<T> ref,
                     String argName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and not empty (size >= 1). Size is defined as the number of elements.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref or argName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if number of elements in ref is zero, or if argName is empty or whitespace
        See Also:
        checkSizeRange(Collection, int, int, String), checkMinSize(Collection, int, String)

      • checkMinSize

        public static <T> void checkMinSize(Collection<T> ref,
                    int minSize,
                    String argName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and has a minimum size. Size is defined as the number of elements.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        minSize - minimum number of elements (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref or argName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if minSize < 0, or if number of elements in ref is outside allowed range, or if argName is empty or whitespace
        See Also:
        checkSizeRange(Collection, int, int, String)

      • checkExactSize

        public static <T> void checkExactSize(Collection<T> ref,
                      int exactSize,
                      String argName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and has an exact size. Size is defined as the number of elements.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        exactSize - exact number of elements (inclusive). Must be non-negative.
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref or argName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if exactSize < 0, or if number of elements in ref is outside allowed range, or if argName is empty or whitespace
        See Also:
        checkSizeRange(Collection, int, int, String)

      • checkElementsNotNull

        public static <T> void checkElementsNotNull(Collection<T> ref,
                            String argName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and each element is not null. An empty collection will pass this test.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref (or any element) or argName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if argName is empty or whitespace
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), ArrayArgs.checkElementsNotNull(Object[], String)

      • checkNotEmptyAndElementsNotNull

        public static <T> void checkNotEmptyAndElementsNotNull(Collection<T> ref,
                                       String argName)
        This is a convenience method for checkNotEmpty(Collection, String) and checkElementsNotNull(Collection, String).

      • checkAccessIndex

        public static <T> int checkAccessIndex(Collection<T> ref,
                       int index,
                       String collectionArgName,
                       String indexArgName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and an index is valid to access an element.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        index - index of element to access. Must be non-negative.
        collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
        Returns:
        the validated index
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref, listArgName, or indexArgName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if argName is empty or whitespace
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0, or index >= ref.size()
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkInsertIndex(Collection, int, String, String)

      • checkInsertIndex

        public static <T> int checkInsertIndex(Collection<T> ref,
                       int index,
                       String collectionArgName,
                       String indexArgName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null and an index is valid to insert an element.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        index - index of element to insert. Must be non-negative.
        collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
        Returns:
        the validated index
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref, listArgName, or indexArgName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if argName is empty or whitespace
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0, or index > ref.size()
        See Also:
        ObjectArgs.checkNotNull(Object, String), checkAccessIndex(Collection, int, String, String)

      • checkIndexAndCount

        public static <T> void checkIndexAndCount(Collection<T> ref,
                          int index,
                          int count,
                          String collectionArgName,
                          String indexArgName,
                          String countArgName)
        Tests if a Collection reference is not null, and an index and count is valid to access elements.
        Parameters:
        ref - a collection reference
        index - index of element to access. Must be non-negative.
        count - number of elements to access, starting from index. Must be non-negative.
        collectionArgName - argument name for ref, e.g., "strList" or "searchRegex"
        indexArgName - argument name for index, e.g., "strListIndex"
        countArgName - argument name for count, e.g., "strListCount"
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref, collectionArgName, indexArgName, or countArgName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if index < 0, or if count < 0, or if argName is empty or whitespace
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index >= ref.size(), or if index + count > ref.size()
